```{r setup, include=FALSE}
require(rgdal)
require(leaflet)
require(leaflet.extras)

require(dplyr)
require(readxl)
require(stringr)
```
## R Markdown

```{r}
wells <- readOGR("pa_drilling_2000_2016.geojson")
plot(wells)
```


```{r}
pal <- colorFactor(c("darkmagenta", "indianred2", 'darkgoldenrod1', 'blue', 'orange', 'darkolivegreen4'), 
                   domain=c('COMB. OIL&GAS', 'GAS', 'INJECTION', 'MULTIPLE WELL BORE TYPE', 'OBSERVATION', 'OIL'))

leaflet(data = wells) %>% addMapPane(name = "polygons", zIndex = 410) %>% 
  addMapPane(name = "maplabels", zIndex = 420) %>% # higher zIndex rendered on top
  addProviderTiles("CartoDB.PositronNoLabels", group='Positron') %>% 
  addProviderTiles("CartoDB.PositronOnlyLabels", options = leafletOptions(pane = "maplabels"),
                   group = "map labels") %>%
  addCircles(popup = ~as.character(well_type),
                   label = ~as.character(well_type),
                   radius = 1,
                   color = ~pal(well_type),
                   stroke = FALSE, 
                   fillOpacity =0.5,
                   group = "Well Locations",
                   options = leafletOptions(pane = "polygons")) %>% 
  addLayersControl(baseGroups = c("Positron"),
                   overlayGroups = c("map labels",
                                     "Well Locations"))
```


```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
